description: Dive into "Serene Shores of Kochi" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Serene Shores of Kochi

places.generalDescription: Kuzhuppilly Beach is a serene and well-hidden spot in Kerala, that's perfect for a day spent by the water. With golden sand, crystal blue waters, and an incredible panorama around, it's one of the best beaches in Kochi to visit. The remote location means that it's not crowded and you can really enjoy yourself without feeling rushed.

sources.snippet: Situated near Vypin Island in Kerala, Kuzhuppilly Beach is a lesser-known gem offering serene environs away from the bustling crowds. With its coconut palm-fringed shoreline and gentle waves, it's a preferred spot for both locals and tourists seeking solace and tranquility. The beach also offers splendid sunset views, making it a picturesque spot for evening relaxation.
sources.shortName: 11 Surreal Beaches in Kochi for a Perfect Vacation

sources.snippet: This isolated beach, hidden away from the tourist crowds, provides a quiet break amidst lush coconut forests and swaying palm trees. In all of its pure beauty, Kuzhuppilly Beach is a swimmer's heaven. Its beautiful and sandy beaches provide the ideal setting for a peaceful dip.
sources.shortName: Kochi's Must-See Beach Escapes | Premium Hotels in Kochi

sources.snippet: It is a virgin beach located at a distance of 3.5 km from Cherai beach, Kochi, Kerala. The road to Kuzhuppilly beach, the virgin shore of Kochi is enigmatic with lake on both sides. The islands on each side are dotted with small houses.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches of Kochi (Cochin)

sources.snippet: Kuzhupilly Beach in its flawless wonder is exacting heaven for the visitors. The white and sandy shores structure the ideal background for an unwinding experience. There are occasional kite festivals being conducted here sporadically.
sources.shortName: 5 Unexplored Beaches to Visit Near Kochi, Kerala

sources.snippet: Kuzhupilly village is closely located to Cherai and is about 21kms away from Cochin city. The way to the beach has its own charm with serene backwaters on both sides.

places.name: Kuzhuppilly Beach

reviews.text: Late review: 17 December 2024, One of the best solo trip. Kerala surprises a lot. Spent 4 hours With Sea, Waves and Sun. Less people presence. Thank you Kerala
I like this spot in kuzhuppilly üèñÔ∏è very much.There are so many place to rest,play  and there is no crowd other than main beach.

Visited Kuzhuppilly Beach a few days ago, and I must say-it has now become my second favorite beach in Kerala after Varkala. The atmosphere was vibrant and full of life. Though the beach was quite crowded and parking was a bit tricky (we had to use paid parking), it didn't take away from the overall experience.

We reached around 6 PM, and the timing couldn't have been better. The evening breeze, golden sunlight, and the sound of waves made for a really calming and scenic environment. The highlight of the visit was definitely the floating bridge. It costs around Rs. 120 per person, but it's absolutely worth it. Walking over the waves on a gently swaying bridge while watching the sunset was a unique and memorable experience-it truly elevated our time at the beach.

Whether you're there just to relax, enjoy the breeze, or take in the view, Kuzhuppilly Beach is a great spot. Definitely recommend it for an evening visit!

places.generalDescription: Cherai Beach, located on the fringes of Kochi, is a serene stretch of sand known for its natural beauty and tranquility. Visitors can enjoy activities such as walking, swimming, shell collecting, and even spot dolphins in the Arabian Sea. The beach is part of a larger tourist attraction that includes Vypeen Island, Fort Kochi Beach, Kodanad Elephant Training Centre, Mangalavanam Bird Sanctuary, and Marine Drive.

sources.snippet: With the backdrop of coconut groves as an additional attraction, Cherai Beach is a favorite spot for people looking for a peaceful swim. Stretching down the shore, this lovely beach provides a calm atmosphere ideal for unwinding and basking in the sunlight. Visitors can take relaxing walks along the beach, participate in exciting water sports, or simply relax under the swaying coconut trees of this location, known for its distinctive seashells and frequent sightings of dolphins.
sources.shortName: Kochi's Must-See Beach Escapes | Premium Hotels in Kochi

sources.snippet: Cherai Beach, located on the northern end of Vypin Island in Kerala, is a perfect blend of sea and backwaters making it one of the most visited beaches in Kerala. Its golden sands, clear blue waters, rocks, and coconut trees makes it a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing and weekend retreats away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Like all other famous beaches in Kochi, the Cherai beach also displays a mesmerizing sunset.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches In Kochi

sources.snippet: This beach in Cochin lies in the northern end of Vypeen Island. It is among the best places in Kochi where you can spot the Dolphins along with your kids and family. You are not allowed to swim in the water here but there are various fishermen communities who catch the fishes from the sea using the oldest traditional methods through famous Chinese fishing nets which are a treat to watch.

places.name: Cherai Beach

reviews.text: One of the most popular beaches in Kochi. Nice to watch the sunset, you can see the fishermen bringing in their catch, maybe you can even buy right there. Only downside was the smell, maybe we were in the wrong time but there was unpleasant smell.

"Clean, Calm, and Perfect for a Relaxing Getaway!"
Cherai Beach is one of the most beautiful and peaceful beaches near Kochi. With golden sands, gentle waves, and a clean shoreline, it's perfect for a relaxing day out.

Cherai Beach is one of the most beautiful and peaceful spots to visit near Ernakulam. If you're a beach lover, this place is a perfect getaway. The beach is clean, calm, and truly lives up to the title of "Queen of the Arabian Sea." You'll even spot some rus (local fishing boats), adding to the authentic coastal vibe.

One of the best parts? There's a lovely beachside restaurant wave restaurant where you can relax, eat, and enjoy a stunning view of the waves. They offer both indoor and outdoor seating, so you can choose to dine under the open sky or chill inside while still catching a glimpse of the ocean.

It's also super convenient for visitors - there's ample car parking available, so no worries on that front.

Whether you're there for the food, the views, or just to walk barefoot on the shore, Cherai Beach is totally worth the trip.

places.generalDescription: Fort Kochi Beach, located in Kochi, Kerala, is a serene seafront destination with a paved walkway offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea and the iconic Chinese fishing nets. The beach is part of a picturesque coastline that spans nearly 1km and features benches for visitors to relax and enjoy the sea breeze. This area is known for its blend of Indo-European architecture seen in old churches and temples, making it a popular attraction for tourists exploring Cochin.

sources.snippet: Situated between the aluminium industries and the Cochin Port, Fort Kochi Beach is one of the iconic beaches in the region, reflecting the rich history and its cultural glory. The beach, at the root of the mediaeval port town of Fort Kochi, still retains its popularity for touring colonial-era architectures and monuments such as Chinese fishing nets and the remains of Fort Emmanuel. The beach is a most eye-catching golden sand stretch, perpendicularly lined by the Arabian Sea.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Beaches In Kochi That Are Alluring To The Core

sources.snippet: Fort Kochi Beach, the venue of the annual colourful celebration 'Cochin Carnival', can be easily identified by the presence of Chinese fishing nets. The beach has a pathway that runs along the coastline for nearly 1km or more, with benches to sit and relax and enjoy the breeze and the sea view. A stroll along the beach, particularly at sunset with the Chinese fishing nets and sailing ships in the background will be a memorable experience.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Kochi, Most Popular beaches in ernakulam district, Explore beaches in Kochi

sources.snippet: A beautiful and serene beach adjoining the Arabian Sea, Fort Kochi is the most famous beach in Kochi. The colonial-style bungalows, along the shoreline, the remains of Fort Emmanuel, rows of Chinese fishing nets, and the Vasco da Gama Square, make the place more appealing for visitors. You can just stroll and enjoy the beautiful sights or participate in diverse water activities like fishing, dolphin sighting, boat cruising, and more.
sources.shortName: 11 Beaches in Kochi That You Must Visit on Your Vacation

sources.snippet: Fort Kochi Beach, surrounded by famous attractions like St. Francis Church and the Chinese fishing nets, has an age-old charm that draws tourists from all over the world. Here, visitors can learn about the rich maritime history of the city, visit small cafes and art galleries, or simply enjoy the beauty of a spectacular sunset over the Arabian Sea. The renowned Cochin Carnival takes place on these beaches on New Year's Eve.

A wide variety of water activities are available, from relaxing strolls to fishing, seeing dolphins, and touring the waterways on a boat.

Apart from these nets, the remains of Fort Emmanuel, the colonial-style bungalows along the seashore, and the Vasco da Gama Square are some other points of interests in the area.

places.name: Fort Kochi Beach

reviews.text: Visited Fort Kochi Beach at night and absolutely loved the calm, breezy atmosphere. The sound of waves, cool sea breeze, and the dimly lit walkway created a serene vibe-perfect for a peaceful stroll after a long day. The Chinese fishing nets look beautiful under the streetlights, and you can still see a few locals around, enjoying the quiet.

beach boasts powdery white sand and atmosphere was incredibly relaxing, with only the sound of gentle waves. It's perfect for enjoying the stunning sunrise and sunsets. water appears to be a little unclean and lot of unwanted stuff inside the sea....pollution somewhere

*-*

Fort Kochi Beach quietly unfolds its charm, especially during the off-season when the usual tide of tourists ebbs away, revealing a serene and peaceful shoreline. In these quieter months, the beach offers a restful escape-calm, uncrowded, and perfect for reflective strolls or taking in the gentle lull of coastal life.

The atmosphere is defined by the soft murmur of conversations, the distant ebb of waves, and the rhythmic dance of Chinese fishing nets silhouetted against the sky. The locals, known for their genuine warmth and easygoing nature, add a welcoming touch-friendly interactions feel natural, uncomplicated, and heartfelt.

For an evening visit, Fort Kochi Beach proves particularly rewarding. As the sun inches toward the horizon, it paints the sky and sea in hues of gold and rose, making the waterfront a must-visit for those seeking tranquil beauty. Nearby, a collection of modest stalls and caf√©s provide delightful culinary fare-fresh seafood, traditional snacks, and refreshing coconut water-perfect companions to an evening well-spent by the water's edge.

Whether you're visiting solo, with friends, or as a couple, Fort Kochi Beach blends tranquility, scenic charm, and genuine hospitality in an atmosphere that's both soothing and intimate-making it an excellent choice for spending quality time in a quiet coastal setting.

---

places.generalDescription: Munambam Beach, also known as Muziris Beach, is a picturesque and active fishing harbor in Kochi. It offers stunning views of the mouth of the river Periyar and Chinese fishing net boats. The beach doesn't allow personal vehicles but provides parking for a fee. It's a romantic spot to watch the sunset and is popular for kite-flying.

sources.snippet: This is one of the active and huge fishing harbors in Kochi. It offers the best places for experiencing major natural attractions of Kerala such as the mouth of the river Periyar or Chinese fishing net boats. An important guideline for all the people traveling with their own vehicles, this beach doesn‚Äôt allow personal vehicles inside the beach and you have to pay a certain fee for parking inside the beach.

places.name: Munambam Beach

reviews.text:
Munambam Beach is a serene and picturesque spot in Kochi, Kerala. It's known for its beautiful shoreline, where the Periyar River meets the Arabian Sea. The beach is also famous for its traditional Chinese fishing nets, which add to its unique charm.
The easiest way to reach Munambam Beach is by bus, and the closest train station is Aluva Railway Station, about 27 kilometers away. Ernakulam Railway Station is a bit farther, around 40 kilometers. From either station, you can easily catch a bus or taxi to the beach.

Munambam Beach is historically significant as it's part of the ancient Muziris port. Archaeological findings suggest it was a hub for spice trade with the Middle East and Europe. The area is rich in artifacts like Roman coins and pottery, showcasing its vibrant past.

Cherai Beach is a great spot for a relaxed day by the sea. The beach offers exciting water sports like jet skiing and boating, making it perfect for thrill-seekers. There's also ample space for beach volleyball, ideal for group fun and games.

The long stretch of the shoreline is perfect for peaceful walks and the calm atmosphere makes it a great place to unwind. The waters are safe and inviting if you're looking to take a dip and cool off.

Watch traditional Chinese fishing nets in action.

Overall, Cherai Beach is a small and well-rounded destination for both little adventure and relaxation.

"A Peaceful Escape with Stunning Views!"
Munambam Beach is a hidden gem near Cherai, perfect for those seeking peace and natural beauty. It's less crowded than other beaches, offering a serene atmosphere where you can truly relax.

places.address: 55G7+HF3, Cherai Beach - Munambam Rd, Munambam, Vypin, Kerala 683515, India

places.generalDescription: Vypin Beach, located on Vypin Island in Kerala, is renowned for its natural beauty and tranquil ambiance. Surrounded by lush greenery and palm trees, it offers stunning views of the Arabian Sea. The beach's proximity to other popular tourist spots in Kochi adds to its allure. Additionally, Vypin Beach holds cultural and historical significance.

sources.snippet: Situated around 5 km from Ernakulam in Kochi, Vypin Beach is a part of Vypin Island. Sprawling in an area of 25 Km, Vypin Island is in the southwestern Indian state of Kerala. With thrilling trekking trails, beautiful beaches, sun-kissed shores, and old lighthouses, the Vypeen Island makes a perfect spot for tourists.
sources.shortName: 11 Beaches in Kochi That You Must Visit on Your Vacation

sources.snippet: Vypin Beach is an undisturbed piece of coastline rich with natural beauty and diversity. This undeveloped beach on Vypin Island is ideal for nature and animal enthusiasts. Visitors can explore the thick mangrove forests, observe unique bird species, or simply relax in the peaceful surroundings.
sources.shortName: Kochi's Must-See Beach Escapes | Premium Hotels in Kochi

sources.snippet: Another famous beach in the exciting town of Kochi, Njarackal Arattuvazhi beach, is also called the Silent beach. The beach is less crowded as compared to other beaches in Kochi. Dolphin sightings are frequent here, which acts as an attraction to this beach.

places.name: Vypin Beach

reviews.text: Vypin Beach is a beautiful and peaceful spot to visit. It feels private and secure, with a calm and quiet atmosphere that makes it perfect for relaxation. The long stretch of beach is ideal for walking and enjoying the sea breeze. There are many food stalls nearby, so you can easily grab a snack while spending time here. It is also one of the best places for photography, especially wedding photos, with the stunning backdrop of the sea and the iconic lighthouse adding extra charm. A great beach to visit for both leisure and special occasions.

Absolutely loved this beach! It's calm, quiet, and perfect for anyone looking to relax and unwind. The atmosphere is so peaceful - just sitting there and watching the waves felt incredibly soothing. There are side rocks where you can sit comfortably and enjoy the sunset, which made for a truly beautiful experience. Had a great time and would definitely visit again!

Its one of the good beach in Cochin. Its not much famous but its good in cleanliness ,
And accommodations are not available near the beach.

There are also a number of small shops and food stalls near the beach, offering local snacks and souvenirs.

In addition to its natural beauty, Vypin beach is also well-known for the annual Cochin.

places.generalDescription: Kuzhuppilly Beach is a stunning and picturesque coastal destination where the shoreline is adorned with lush vegetation. This idyllic beach boasts a serene ambiance with gentle waves, making it perfect for a refreshing swim. The captivating sunset vistas offered here are truly mesmerizing and are sure to delight any visitor's eyes. Located approximately 23 kilometers away from Ernakulam city center, this beach has gained popularity as a must-visit destination.
places.name: Kuzhuppilly Beach

reviews.text:
Visited Kuzhuppilly Beach a few days ago, and I must say-it has now become my second favorite beach in Kerala after Varkala. The atmosphere was vibrant and full of life. Though the beach was quite crowded and parking was a bit tricky (we had to use paid parking), it didn't take away from the overall experience.

We reached around 6 PM, and the timing couldn't have been better. The evening breeze, golden sunlight, and the sound of waves made for a really calming and scenic environment. The highlight of the visit was definitely the floating bridge. It costs around Rs. 120 per person, but it's absolutely worth it. Walking over the waves on a gently swaying bridge while watching the sunset was a unique and memorable experience-it truly elevated our time at the beach.

Whether you're there just to relax, enjoy the breeze, or take in the view, Kuzhuppilly Beach is a great spot. Definitely recommend it for an evening visit!
Not too crowded. Peaceful beach. Floating bridge is a different experience. But allow to be there in the bridge only for 10 mins.

The soft golden/white sand, pine trees & clean beach can make your day. Since this beach is secluded, it is peaceful and you can picnic with your family & friends for how long ever you want. Swimming & bathing in the waters can be done at your own risk.

places.generalDescription: Puthenthode Beach is a small, serene beach located in Chellanam, 12 km from Kochi city center. The beach is popular for its peaceful vibe and calm environs. It can be accessed by bus. Additionally, the coconut groves add to the vibes of the beach.
places.name: Puthenthodu Beach

reviews.text: If you're seeking a short, peaceful getaway with lovely sunset views and a tranquil ambiance, Puthenthodu Beach hits the mark.
Very nice beach, neat and clean. You can enjoy with family, friends etc. Its too dangerous if you go far beyond. Better not to go too far.
Nice clean beach with not many people. Calm and quiet place.

places.address: Puthenthode Government School Rd, Kannamaly, Kochi, Chellanam, Kerala 682008, India

places.generalDescription: Andhakaranazhi Beach, located 30 kilometers from Kochi, is a hidden gem that offers a relaxed and uncommercialized coastal experience. This virgin beach is an extension of the village of Andhakaranazhi and remains relatively unexploited by tourism. The area is known for its picturesque views of the Arabian Sea, pristine sandy shores, coconut groves, and quaint lighthouse. Fishing is a common sight here as it serves as the main occupation for locals.

sources.snippet: Andhakaranazhi is one of the very few destinations, nested in the lap of nature, that have remained far from public attention, making it an ideal beach for those looking for a peaceful place to de-stress. The crystal-clear water gives hydrophiles one more reason to take a dip. Andhrakazi Beach is one of the very few beaches in the region where the love story between the backwaters and the sea reaches its culmination.
sources.shortName: 8 Top Beaches near Kochi to Lift Your Spirits in 2024

sources.snippet: Andhakaranazhi is formed by the intersection of the Kerala backwater and the Arabian Sea. It is undoubtedly one of the best hidden gems among the shorelines of Kochi. The crystal-clear water, picturesque views of the Arabian Sea, pristine sandy shores, coconut groves, quaint lighthouse and shacks serving delicious coffee, snacks, and juice makes it one of the best beaches in Kochi.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches In Kochi

sources.snippet: The scenic coastal towns and beaches have made Kochi, the best attraction in India for your holidays. This city in Kerala is home to many beaches, but if you are looking for a secluded and serene escape, Andhakaranazhi is one of the best Kochi Beaches to be added to your itinerary. Andhakaranazhi beach is popular among the locals and tourists in the city.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches In Kochi You Mist Visit For A Fun Vacation

sources.snippet: One such place where you can spot dolphins in Kochi is the Andhakaranazhi Beach, famously called ‚ÄòDolphin Beach‚Äô. In the district of Ernakulam, this beach holds the features of a calm atmosphere and beautiful sunsets. Apart from dolphins, here you can indulge in various other activities, such as swimming, sunbathing, and visiting the nearby lighthouse.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Beaches In Kochi That Are Alluring To The Core

sources.snippet: Kochi is the ideal place in India to visit because of its beautiful beaches and other coastal towns. Andhakaranazhi is one of the top Kochi Beaches to add to your schedule if you‚Äôre seeking a private and tranquil retreat in this city in Kerala. Andhakaranazhi beach is a popular destination for both city residents and visitors.
sources.shortName: 8 Most Famous Beaches in Kochi You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Andhakaranazhi Beach, one of Kochi, India‚Äôs best beaches, is the perfect backdrop for your photos. Because of the laid-back atmosphere and abundance of restaurants, you will undoubtedly fall in love and never want to leave. Enjoy some volleyball or a stroll or beach walk while having the time of your life with your loved ones.
sources.shortName: 7 Beaming Beaches In Kochi That You Probably Can't Afford To Miss

sources.snippet: Andhakaranazhi Beach is a hidden gem located near Kochi, offering picturesque views of the Arabian Sea. It serves as a serene getaway, providing a delightful contrast to the bustling city life of Kochi. The pristine sandy shores, coconut groves, and a quaint lighthouse are major attractions for both tourists and locals.
sources.shortName: 11 Surreal Beaches in Kochi for a Perfect Vacation

sources.snippet: One of the best beaches in Kochi, Andhakaranazhi Beach, is located at a distance of 30 KM from the city. The beach is a confluence of the Kerala backwaters and the Arabian Sea. Nested in the lap of nature, Andhakaranazhi Beach is a quaint or hidden gem in Kochi.
sources.shortName: 11 Beaches in Kochi That You Must Visit on Your Vacation

places.name: Andhakaranazhi Beach

reviews.text: It's a relatively less crowded beach, offering a peaceful escape with views of the sea breeze and a natural underwater ridge. Visitors often enjoy walks, relaxation, and watching the sunset.

Beautiful and scenic view in andhakaranazhi beach
A little crowded but that was because I went on a weekend day
Other wise really good place to visit :)

Witnessed one of the best sunset recently. The beach sets the mood right with its scenic beauty. Always a good choice for family outing. It seems a bit crowded on weekends. Parking facility is available.

places.generalDescription: Puthuvype Beach, located in Fort Kochi, Ernakulam, is a stunning destination known for its natural beauty and historical landmarks. The beach boasts Chinese fishing nets, a French street, and golden sands that make it a picturesque spot for beach selfies. Visitors can explore St. Francis Church with the remains of Vasco da Gama, the Dutch cemetery near the seashore, and the five-century-old Portuguese-built Santa Cruz Basilica.

sources.snippet: Best scenic destinations and insta filters are of no use here as the natural beauty of this top beach in Kochi is in itself a fabulous filter for all your beach selfies. Amazing turquoise waters, golden sand, and a tall lighthouse at the back serve an amazing combination for your beach trip photos. The best time to visit the beach is between 3 pm and 5 pm as you can enter the major highlight of this beach of Kochi, which is a lighthouse providing entry only during those hours.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Kochi, Kerala

sources.snippet: One of the less-visited beaches near Kochi, Puthuvype Beach, is known only among the locals and tourists who love to visit unexplored areas. Situated near the lighthouse in Kochi, Puthuvype Beach is adorned with golden sand, crystal clear turquoise water, and an ancient lighthouse, enhancing the magnificence of this beach. This serene beach in Kochi city provides a perfect setting for those willing to take a break from their monotonous city life.
sources.shortName: 11 Beaches in Kochi That You Must Visit on Your Vacation

sources.snippet: With its pristine sands and lush green settings, the secluded Puthuvype Beach provides a refuge for those looking for some peace and quiet. This beach in Kochi is an absolute must-see if you're not a fan of crowds, as it is one of Kerala's less populated beaches. Visitors can take long walks along the beach, admire stunning views of the Arabian Sea, or simply relax with a book beneath the shade of a palm tree.
sources.shortName: Kochi's Must-See Beach Escapes | Premium Hotels in Kochi

sources.snippet: Situated near the city of Kochi, Puthuvype Beach is a tranquil and picturesque destination that attracts both locals and tourists. Characterized by its vast expanse of golden sands and calm azure waters, the beach provides an ideal setting for relaxation. The Puthuvype Lighthouse, located close to the beach, offers panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and is a major attraction.
sources.shortName: 11 Surreal Beaches in Kochi for a Perfect Vacation

sources.snippet: Puthyvype Beach has one of the less visited yet exceptionally lovely shorelines. It is situated in the special industrial zone of Kerala. Located 5km away from Eranakulam high court junction, it is surrounded by Vembanad Lake which is the largest lake in Kerala in one side, the Arabian Sea on the other side and the small village town of Njarakkal on the northern end.
sources.shortName: 5 Unexplored Beaches to Visit Near Kochi, Kerala

sources.snippet: Situated about 16.8 km off the city centre, Puthuvype Beach is otherwise serene and somewhat isolated. The beach offers tranquillity away from the hustle and bustle of Kochi, with its golden sand and calm, deep blue waters. One of the main attractions in Puthuvype Beach is the Puthuvype Lighthouse, which lets you capture the panoramic views of the Arabian Sea.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Beaches In Kochi That Are Alluring To The Core

sources.snippet: Puthuvype Beach is one of the less-visited beaches in the Kochi region, known only to locals and adventure-seeking visitors. Puthuvype Beach, next to Kochi‚Äôs lighthouse, is stunning because of its golden sand, blue ocean, and historic lighthouse. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life, go no further than this tranquil beach in Kochi.
sources.shortName: 8 Most Famous Beaches in Kochi You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Puthuvype Beach is a peaceful heaven suitable for vacationers who want to unwind and intermingle with nature. It‚Äôs the place where you can get everything: the sand is clean, and the water is transparent, so it is a perfect place for swimming and tanning yourself. Take a dip in the sea or sit on the beach and relax to unwind and make the most of your holiday.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Kochi You Must Visit

sources.snippet: If you are looking for some peace and calm from the daily grind, then Puthuvype Beach is the perfect destination as it is one of the least crowded beaches in Kochi. Its vast expanse of golden sands and calm deep blue waters makes it an ideal place for some relaxation. Tourists can enjoy the panoramic views of the Arabian Sea from the Puthuvype Lighthouse.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches In Kochi

sources.snippet: Don‚Äôt get confused if you are unable to locate the Puthuvype beach on the map. It is one of the less frequented beaches that are known only to the locals and seasoned travelers who love to explore the unexplored. The good thing is that the lack of publicity has worked in the beach‚Äôs favor, helping it preserve its natural beauty.
sources.shortName: 8 Top Beaches near Kochi to Lift Your Spirits in 2024

sources.snippet: One of the longest beaches near Kochi, Puthuvype is also one of the least crowded beaches in Kochi. A part of Vypin Island, Puthuvype is bounded by Vembanad Lake in the east, the Arabian Sea in the southwest and Njarakkal on the Northern side. The main accesses in the area are Vypin-Munambam Road and LNG Terminal Road.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Kochi

sources.snippet: Despite its proximity to the city center, this is one of Kochi‚Äôs less crowded beaches. It is an excellent location for watching a sunset, which will brighten your evenings. After Cherai Beach, Puthuvype Beach is one of the most visited beaches in Kochi.
sources.shortName: 7 Beaming Beaches In Kochi That You Probably Can't Afford To Miss

sources.snippet: It is a virgin beach located at a distance of 3.5 km from Cherai beach, Kochi, Kerala. The road to Kuzhuppilly beach, the virgin shore of Kochi is enigmatic with lake on both sides. The islands on each side are dotted with small houses.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches of Kochi (Cochin)

sources.snippet: One of the less visited but yet beautiful beach is Puthuvype. A light house arguably said to be the tallest in India is situated less than half a kilometer away from the beach. Entry to the light house is permitted from 3 P.M to 5 P.M.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Kochi, Most Popular beaches in ernakulam district, Explore beaches in Kochi

places.name: Puthuvype Beach

reviews.text: Tracked down a hidden gem at Cochin. Small, peaceful and quiet beach. Popular photo shoot spot for couples. Brilliant sea view. Fishermen riding the boats across the sea. Few shops around the corner. Morning is perfect as it's less crowded. See my frames and cherish the moments.

This beautiful beach is a great place to relax in the evenings. Pine trees line the shore, creating a peaceful and scenic atmosphere. It seems to be a popular spot for couples and families with children.

A peaceful beach with a great vibe. Visited during the rains, and the experience was amazing with strong winds and light drizzle. The beach is calm and serene. The nearby lighthouse adds to the charm, and the swaying wind-blown trees make it even more beautiful.

places.generalDescription: Kuzhupilly Beach, situated near Cherai Beach in Kochi, is a tranquil and unspoiled destination. The long stretch of sandy shoreline, adorned with large rocks and pine trees, offers an ideal setting for a relaxing getaway with friends and family. It is a great spot for swimming and occasionally hosts the Kite festival. Beyond the beach, visitors can explore paddy fields and backwaters.

sources.snippet: Kuzhuppilly Beach in Kochi is 3.5 kilometres away from Cherai Beach and is extremely well hidden, even from locals. Because the shore is lined by massive boulders, the area is ideal for a romantic getaway or even if you want to spend some time away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Two lakes flank on either side of the winding road, making the journey to the beach equally beautiful.
sources.shortName: 7 Beaming Beaches In Kochi That You Probably Can't Afford To Miss

sources.snippet: Some travelers love to spend time on pristine beaches, while others have a thing for backwaters. Kuzhupilly Beach combines the best of both worlds. It is located in Kuzhupilly, a village in Vypin Island, Ernakulam district of Kerala.
sources.shortName: 8 Top Beaches near Kochi to Lift Your Spirits in 2024

places.name: Kuzhupilly beach

reviews.text: Amazing beach and clean surroundings . Good place to spend an evening near kochi . Parking space available . Small snacking place also available . During monsoon sea may get rough . So take caution if you are with kids .

Great Seashore! The cleanliness and peacefulness of the surroundings make it an absolute haven for families. The accessibility is top-notch, making it easy to get here with kids and elderly. We spent an eve soaking in the sun, playing games. The atmosphere is so calm and serene, it's perfect for a relaxing day out. Highly recommend for a stress-free family outing!
Peaceful and clean. Less crowded than cherai beach. Floating bridge is also available for 120/- to spend 10 minutes. Great place to spend time and enjoy the sunset.

sources.snippet: Though the beach area itself is gratifying enough to spend the whole of your vacation, there are many other beautiful areas in and around Cherai beach. Azheekal Sree Varaha temple is just one kilometre from the beach which is famous for the special chariot kept in the temple. Tourists also visit the Pallippuram Fort which was built by the Portuguese in the year 1503.
sources.shortName: Cherai Beach Kochi (Timings, History, Entry Fee, Images & Information)

reviews.text: Cherai Beach, located near Kochi in Kerala, is a serene and scenic coastal destination known for its clean sands and gentle waves. Bordered by coconut groves and backwaters, the beach offers a peaceful ambiance ideal for relaxation. It is well-maintained and relatively less crowded, making it suitable for families and quiet getaways. Visitors can enjoy activities like swimming, beach walks, and occasional dolphin sightings. Overall, Cherai Beach presents a harmonious blend of natural beauty and calm, making it one of Kerala's charming coastal retreats.
Visit this place after 4 pm you'll love this view üòç

Cheari Beach is a decent destination that we've visited several times. It offers a pleasant beach experience, ideal for beach activities like swimming.

On weekends, it tends to get crowded, which can affect the overall experience. Parking can be a bit tricky during peak times, so it's best to arrive early.

The beach is conveniently located near shops where you can find food, drinks, and beachwear, making it convenient for a day out by the sea. Overall, Cheari Beach is a great spot for beach lovers, despite the weekend crowds and parking challenges.

places.generalDescription: The Mahatma Gandhi Beach in Kochi is a picturesque and small beach known for its excellent sunset views. It is also home to a number of food vendors selling casual street food. However, the scene of garbage scattered around the beach did not look good.

sources.snippet: Such a famous national name is given to this beach due to its similar popularity. Mahatama Gandhi beach is the best beach nearby Kochi airport having major highlightsfor yacht and cruise ships. This beach does not have a long coastline and its not favorable to swim in this beach as the water is deep and is apparent for big vessels and cruise ships.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Kochi, Kerala

sources.snippet: If you are looking for some great seafood tasting places in Kochi, then this place is for you. More than the beach it‚Äôs the long line of food shacks and restaurants that will grab your attention. Having said that, it doesn‚Äôt mean that you have to overlook the beach and focus on food.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches In Kochi

places.name: Mahatma Gandhi Beach

reviews.text:
Awesome beach.
Nice wind.
At night time also we can come here.
Tea shops are here.
Good vibe place

The beach of Fort Cochin, in close proximity to the Bastian Bungalow, the Chinese Nets, has steam boilers in its premises, one may shop for local arts crafts and eat and drink in the beach walkway.
I don't know why this beach has the name which it has. Even after having a history of 400 years of colonial rule ü§î

This beach is a very well maintained pleasant beach with amazing sunrise view. Great for a long walk alongside Fort kochi. Peppered with local markets, fresh fish shops, this is the quintessential Indian beach family experience.

To note this beach is not something with a coastline, so you cannot walk on the sand but you do have a raised walkway which let's you enjoy the sound of waves and various views.

Don't miss the ferry experience to Vypin Beach to experience a beautiful sunset and do eat at Seagull and Fort Kochi hotel.

places.generalDescription: Puthuvype Beach is a beautiful, sandy beach that is perfect for a lazy day by the water. The beach is located a short walk from Kochi City Centre, making it easy to get to. There are several snack huts on-site which make it the perfect place to indulge in some delicious food while taking in the stunning views.
places.name: Puthuvype Beach

reviews.text: It felt like a replica of beautiful coastal village of good old times. Kerala never fails to amuse it's admirers. Just a 40 minutes drive from Kochi nestles this less crowded clean beach where you can spend your evenings cozily. I have never seen a beach where so different landforms coexist, you can experience the salty wind from the beach along with a visual treat of rows and rows of casuarina trees (kaattadi). Along side is a wetland area of a small lake with colourful boats and some frolicking cows. It also has mangroves, a must watch from the beautiful lighthouse nearby. The entry fees is just ‚Çπ10/- per person and ‚Çπ10/- for photography. It's in proximity to the beach. You will get a lot of refreshment snacks near the beach. If you wish to take photos or spend a quiet evening with privacy, opt this place. Weekends might be crowded.
Really love this beach! Is usually crowded during weekends and holidays. Comparatively clean and has ample parking space. You get to fly kites, but be responsible, do not litter.

It's a very popular and beautiful beach . Usually crowded in weekends and parking gets filled up near to beach . Make sure not to get your car stuck in the sand if you try to get close to the beach . It's advance to leave the car in beach road and then walk a little . Else you Will get stuck in sand or crowd . But over all good place to spend time with your family and kids love it . It's a bit sandwiched between the walls of IOC .

places.generalDescription: Njarackal Arattuvazhi Beach is a popular tourist attraction in Kochi due to its location, minimal crowd, and calm atmosphere. The beach is also attractive for its sunset views.

sources.snippet: This is another spectacular beach in Kochi, Kerala to experience Dolphins gushing up-n-down while sprinkling seawater adorably from their heads. This is a very less crowded beach in Kochi where you can chill out with your loved ones. They have a superb rocky pathway placed nearby the shores for a nice evening walk under the beautiful hues of sunset spread all over the sky.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Kochi, Kerala

sources.snippet: Also called Narakkal, Njarackal Arattuvazhi beach is situated in the heart of the Vypeen islands in the district. The beach is very popular among the locals, but it remains a hidden gem for travellers. Also known as a silent beach, Njarackal Arattuvazhi beach wins the heart with its beauty and serenity.
sources.shortName: 11 Beaches in Kochi That You Must Visit on Your Vacation

sources.snippet: Photo: Sampad007 / Wikimedia Commons / Image For Representation Only. Njarakkal Arattuvazhi Beach, also known as the ‚ÄòSilent Beach‚Äô, is a not-so-popular but equally fine beach in the region. The surroundings of this beach are calm compared to some of the famous beaches in Kochi, which have fewer crowds.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Beaches In Kochi That Are Alluring To The Core

sources.snippet: Njanrakkal also called as Narakkal is a place in Ernakulam district in Kerala. It is located at the heart of Vypeen islands in the district. This beach town is quite popular among the natives but when it comes to other travelers, this beach is still an unexplored gem.
sources.shortName: 5 Unexplored Beaches to Visit Near Kochi, Kerala

places.name: Njarackal Arattuvazhi Beach

reviews.text:
Njarackal Arattuvazhi Beach is a serene and beautiful destination perfect for relaxation and unwinding. The beach offers a peaceful ambiance with its clean shores, gentle waves, and stunning sunset views. It's less crowded compared to other beaches, making it ideal for those seeking a calm and refreshing getaway.

The scenic coastline, combined with the soothing sea breeze, creates a perfect spot for evening strolls or quiet moments by the water. Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or simply looking for a tranquil escape, Njarackal Arattuvazhi Beach is a must-visit.

Highly recommended for families, friends, and solo travelers alike...

Best place for evening hangouts.
There is not much area to play in the beach but the rocks placed ashore offers you a great view of the sea. There is ample space for parking and the beach is not much crowded. Best place to watch a sunset.

One of the hidden gems in kochi, though this place isn't exactly a beach! but one can enjoy the sunset sitting on the rocks, watching aggressive waves clashing the shore walls. There is a Aqua tourism spot near this place operated by Matsya feds where boating activities are available.. No restaurants or eateries can be seen, it is better to carry some snacks but remember not to litter the place ;)
